title: import error.unknown ancestor?
body:
new Geth version, when I run export, it work well.
but when I.run import, log show as below:
```
########## BAD BLOCK #########
Block: 1 (0x0df5da8a2e7a24ddfa2de2cfff9522a3fb35d0c359a6c6ea2ef25dca7f438f0d)
Error: unknown ancestor
Platform: geth (devel) go1.19.1 arm64 darwin
VCS: c2e0abce-20221117
Chain config: &params.ChainConfig{ChainID:1, HomesteadBlock:1150000, DAOForkBlock:1920000, DAOForkSupport:true, EIP150Block:2463000, EIP150Hash:0x2086799aeebeae135c246c65021c82b4e15a2c451340993aacfd2751886514f0, EIP155Block:2675000, EIP158Block:2675000, ByzantiumBlock:4370000, ConstantinopleBlock:7280000, PetersburgBlock:7280000, IstanbulBlock:9069000, MuirGlacierBlock:9200000, BerlinBlock:12244000, LondonBlock:12965000, ArrowGlacierBlock:13773000, GrayGlacierBlock:15050000, MergeNetsplitBlock:<nil>, ShanghaiBlock:<nil>, CancunBlock:<nil>, TerminalTotalDifficulty:58750000000000000000000, TerminalTotalDifficultyPassed:true, Ethash:(*params.EthashConfig)(0x106ac4070), Clique:(*params.CliqueConfig)(nil)}
Receipts: 
##############################
 
ERROR[11-21|15:38:36.989] Import error                             err="invalid block 50: unknown ancestor"
```

what happened?is a bug?

when get block from db use hash and number, it get wrong.
It may be wrong,anyone sold this?

For some reason your node tries to import a block with hash `0x0df5da8a2e7a24ddfa2de2cfff9522a3fb35d0c359a6c6ea2ef25dca7f438f0d` as block `1` (https://etherscan.io/block/1). Where does that block come from -- are you doing a `geth import` ?
yes,But I run a private network use Geth
Your config looks like you're using mainnet. In order to run a private network, you need to do `geth init <genesis>` with your custom genesis.

yes，I have done this .
I definitely sure I am use my private network.
Now,I want to try rollback use export and import.
Seems import cause error.
when get block from db use hash and number, it get wrong.
Could you please provide the first ~100 lines of text from that is printed when you start up geth?

invalid block 50: unknown ancestor

`/geth --datadir /Users/csquan/testchain1/datanew import`

You import the exported chain data to your new node directly. Mainnet chain configuration is used by default.

You have to also initialize your new node first via `geth init genesis --datadir new-node`
yes, thankyou，it solve m y problem
